title: 76ers draft Broome, Suns land Fleming in Round 2
content: Johni Broome went to the 76ers with the No. 35 pick while Rasheer Fleming ended up with the Suns via trade as the NBA draft wrapped up Thursday night.

title: Sources: Texas State closing on move to Pac-12
content: Texas State officials began alerting Sun Belt officials of its formal offer to the Pac-12 and plans to accept, sources told ESPN.

title: Rays' Franco found guilty in sexual abuse case
content: Rays shortstop Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in the Dominican Republic and received a suspended two-year prison sentence Thursday.

title: Ex-Ravens PK Tucker gets 10-week suspension
content: Former Ravens kicker Justin Tucker has been suspended for the first 10 weeks of the 2025 regular season after the NFL found that he violated its personal conduct policy.

title: Sources: Team in top five told not to pick Bailey
content: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five that they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing and that he wouldn't report if it did, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets fear Canning has Achilles injury, await MRI
content: The Mets' Griffin Canning is set to undergo imaging after leaving Thursday's start because of a noncontact injury, and the team fears it's his Achilles.

title: Alabama gets commitment from No. 3 RB Crowell
content: Alabama secured its highest-ranked commitment in the 2026 class Thursday when four-star rusher Ezavier Crowell, ESPN's No. 3 running back prospect and No. 2 recruit from the state of Alabama, committed to the Crimson Tide.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

content: Which signings, trades and extensions should still happen this offseason? We suggested one final move for every NFL team as we near training camp.

content: Four of the Florida high school's Class of 2024 starting five were selected as first-rounders in this year's draft.

title: Vini: Assist for Valverde 'one of the best' of career
content: Vin√≠cius J√∫nior said his backheel assist for Federico Valverde in Real Madrid's 3-0 Club World Cup win over Salzburg on Thursday was "one of the best of my career."

title: Haaland outpaces Messi, Mbapp√© to 300 goals

title: Real Madrid advance, set up Juventus CWC clash
content: Real Madrid sealed their passage to the Club World Cup round of 16 as Group H leaders, defeating Salzburg 3-0 on Thursday night at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia.

title: Athletic press LaLiga on Bar√ßa signing Williams
content: Athletic Club have confirmed they met with LaLiga to question Barcelona's ability to sign players within the league's financial fair play rules amid the Catalan side's ongoing pursuit of Nico Williams.

title: Pep: 'Long time' since Man City played this well
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said his players got the chance to remember "what it was like to be a good team" as they thrashed Juventus 5-2.

title: Mexico's Ch√°vez out of Gold Cup after tearing ACL
content: Mexico midfielder Luis Chavez tore his right anterior cruciate ligament while training ahead of the Gold Cup quarterfinal match against Saudi Arabia and will now depart camp to receive medical treatment.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M
content: Liverpool have completed the signing of Bournemouth left-back Milos Kerkez, the Premier League champions have announced.

content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

content: Taylor Swift performs 'Shake It Off' and walks the red carpet with Travis Kelce at Tight End University.

content: Following the summer camp circuit, the newest rankings have some big changes for the class's signal-callers.

content: Whether you're a weekly watcher or a casual Cup fan, this guide will get you up to speed on the drivers in the bracket.

content: Andre Snellings looks at what fantasy managers can expect from Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper, Ace Bailey and other touted rookies in fantasy basketball next season.

content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: 'Wanted to kill Khamenei but ...': Israel reveals how Ayatollah evaded assassination; key details
content: During the recent conflict, Israeli defence minister Israel Katz revealed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a target for assassination but evaded capture by going into hiding. Despite this, Israel launched airstrikes, killing Iranian commanders and nuclear scientists, aiming to destabilize Iran's leadership.

title: Student raped on law college premises; three, including staffer, arrested
content: A student reported a rape incident at a Kolkata law college. Police acted swiftly, arresting three individuals. The accused are Manojit Mishra, Zaib Ahmed, and Pramit Mukhopadhyay. One is accused of the assault, while the others allegedly abetted the crime. They will appear in court in Alipore. Police seek custody for further investigation. The victim's identity remains protected.

title: Watch: Elephants go on rampage at Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat
content: During the Rath Yatra celebrations in Ahmedabad, a male elephant became agitated. The incident occurred near Desai ni Pol in Khadia. Authorities swiftly administered a tranquilizer injection. Female elephants helped to herd the male elephant away. No injuries were reported, and the crowd was quickly controlled. The male elephant is now isolated. The remaining 17 female elephants continued the procession.

title: 'We were told there was a threat': Rohit Sharma spills secrets of IND vs PAK clash
content: Rohit Sharma recalls the electrifying atmosphere surrounding India-Pakistan matches, describing it as a festival-like experience. He lauded Rishabh Pant's crucial innings and the exceptional bowling performance of Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh in the T20 World Cup clash. Sharma emphasized the strategic use of Bumrah and Arshdeep to defend a low total on a challenging pitch.

title: ‚ÄòOperation Narnia‚Äô and 'Red Wedding': How Israel pulled off 'Game of Thrones' on Iran
content: Israel executed strikes against Iran. The operation targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists. It is called 'Red Wedding' and 'Operation Narnia'. US support amplified the effect. Iran's nuclear infrastructure is damaged. Revolutionary Guard leadership is decimated. Israel exposed Iran's weak defenses. A ceasefire is in place. Future talks are uncertain. Iran may accelerate nuclear weaponization. The situation remains tense.

title: US government warns: Green Cards and Visas at risk; will be revoked if ...
content: USCIS has issued a stern warning, stating that immigrants risk losing their green cards and visas if they break the law. The agency emphasized that advocating violence, supporting terrorism, or encouraging such activities will result in ineligibility to remain in the U.S.

title: IND vs ENG ‚Äì Warning bells! 'To win in England, India have got to play Kuldeep Yadav'
content: Following India's underwhelming bowling performance in the first Test, former cricket stars Michael Clarke and Nick Knight have urged the inclusion of Kuldeep Yadav. Clarke criticized India's selection strategy, emphasizing the need to prioritize wicket-taking over bolstering batting depth.

title: Internal war in K'taka Cong? What CM Siddaramaiah said on minister's claim
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed claims of internal disputes and potential political shifts within the state government, refuting statements made by minister KN Rajanna. Rajanna had earlier hinted at possible changes after September due to multiple power centers within the Congress, fueling speculation of a cabinet reshuffle or even a change in CM.

title: Cash in hand, killers on call: Mother-daughter love triangle ends in husband‚Äôs killing
content: A newlywed man was murdered in a meticulously planned conspiracy orchestrated by his wife and her lover. The illicit affair fueled the crime, as they hired contract killers and used GPS tracking to monitor the victim's movements.

title: America‚Äôs China threat: Huawei‚Äôs new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: Congress takes jab at Centre as Trump teases 'great' trade deal with India
content: Amidst Donald Trump's announcement of an impending 'very big deal' with India, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has criticised the Centre, linking it to the 'abrupt' conclusion of Operation Sindoor. Trump's repeated claims of using trade discussions to halt India-Pakistan confrontations have been met with skepticism. Ramesh suggests India is learning about crucial decisions from Washington DC.

title: India-US trade deal: Energy, & low tariffs - what will be in 'very big' pact
content: Trade talks between India and the US are gaining momentum, potentially leading to a significant agreement. President Trump hinted at a "very big" deal to open up India, focusing on sectors like energy, agriculture, and defense.

title: 'Avoid new complexities': Rajnath's message to China after firm stance on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Chinese counterpart, Dong Jun, in Qingdao during the SCO Defence Ministers' Meeting, where they discussed the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Suspended initially due to Covid-19 in 2020 and later due to the Galwan Valley clash, the pilgrimage is now set to resume. Singh also gifted Dong Jun a Madhubani painting from Bihar as a gesture of goodwill.

title: Passport Seva 2.0 in India: e-Passports to boost travel security
content: India's passport services have undergone a significant transformation, as acknowledged by External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar on Passport Seva Divas. The Passport Seva Programme (PSP) streamlines application processes, extending facilities to Tier 2 and 3 cities through Post Office Passport Seva Kendras. The introduction of e-Passports, embedded with secure microchips, enhances security and expedites border crossings.

title: ‚ÄòLike H-1B without lottery‚Äô: What is O-1 visa? check details
content: The O-1 visa is gaining traction among professionals and companies as an alternative to the H-1B, offering a route to work in the US for those with extraordinary abilities. With rising O-1A approvals and a high success rate, STEM graduates, researchers, and artists are increasingly pursuing this option.

title: 'Never accepted Constitution': Congress hits back at RSS
content: Jairam Ramesh of Congress has strongly criticized the RSS for allegedly never accepting the Indian Constitution and attacking its framers. This response follows RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's remark questioning the inclusion of "Socialist" and "Secular" in the Constitution. Ramesh highlighted past calls by the RSS and BJP for a new Constitution, which he claims were rejected by the public.

title: 'Constitution in hand' politics: EAM mocks Rahul, blames 'family' for Emergency
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has criticised the Congress party and Rahul Gandhi for their alleged hypocrisy regarding constitutional values, pointing to their failure to apologise for the Emergency. He accused them of flashing the Constitution without truly respecting its spirit, highlighting the Emergency as a dark period where national spirit was suppressed.

title: US-China trade deal: After Trump, China says details of deal ‚Äòconfirmed‚Äô
content: The US and China have finalized a trade deal, with the US agreeing to cancel restrictive measures, according to China. This follows earlier discussions and a negotiation framework established in London. China is expediting rare earth export approvals, a crucial element in high-tech manufacturing, while both economies have faced negative impacts from trade tensions, including declining manufacturing profits and economic slowdown.

title: 'Brightest blast I've ever seen': Fighter pilot recalls Iran strike by B-2 bombers
content: In June 2025, the US military executed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' a strike on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, culminating years of meticulous planning and weapon development. The mission, authorized by President Trump, involved B-2 crews deploying GBU-57 bunker-busters to target the facility's vent shafts. While the US asserts 'total obliteration,' Iran disputes the impact, though the IAEA confirmed extensive damage.

title: Language row to unite Thackeray brothers? What Sanjay Raut said
content: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray are joining forces. They will protest the mandatory Hindi language imposition in Maharashtra schools. Sanjay Raut announced a joint march on July 5. This collaboration marks a significant moment. It is a united front on Marathi identity. The leaders aim to protect language rights. They want to prevent division on this crucial issue.

title: 'Will you let me sleep?': Shikhar reveals smuggling girlfriend into room shared with Rohit Sharma; Hitman said ...
content: Shikhar Dhawan, in his autobiography, revealed a past relationship during the 2006 India A tour to Australia. He secretly brought his girlfriend into his hotel room, shared with Rohit Sharma, leading to distractions and impacting his performance. A senior selector spotted them, and despite the romantic interlude, Dhawan later had a successful international career.

title: Watch: Elope? Sanjana Ganesan silences Jasprit Bumrah with hilarious one-liner
content: Despite Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul in the first innings, India faced a five-wicket defeat against England in the first Test at Headingley. Off-field, a pre-marriage anecdote shared by his wife, Sanjana Ganesan, on 'Who's The Boss' added a light-hearted touch.

title: Russia will deliver two more S-400 squadrons to India by 2026-27
content: Russia has assured India that the remaining two squadrons of the S-400 Triumf missile systems will be delivered by 2026-27, despite delays caused by the Russia-Ukraine war. These systems played a crucial role during Operation Sindoor against Pakistan last month. India is also developing its own air defence system, Project Kusha, with operational deployment planned for 2028-2029.

title: Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra 2025: Best wishes, quotes, images to share with your loved ones
content: The Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra, a grand festival in Odisha, will happen on June 27, 2025. Devotees celebrate Lord Jagannath's journey with his siblings to the Gundicha Temple. Sharing wishes and messages on this auspicious day is a common practice. People use Facebook and WhatsApp statuses to express their devotion.

title: 'Your clothes, slippers came from us': BJP MLA‚Äôs comment sparks row
content: Former Maharashtra minister Babanrao Lonikar ignited controversy by criticizing youths for social media criticism despite benefiting from government schemes. His remarks drew swift condemnation from opposition leaders, who deemed them arrogant and insulting. Chief Minister Fadnavis also reprimanded Lonikar, emphasizing the inappropriateness of such statements, especially given the government's service-oriented approach.

title: 'Very big one': Trump hints India, US on cusp of 'great' trade deal; 10 points
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at a significant trade deal with India, following a recent agreement with China. Negotiations are underway in Washington, led by Chief Negotiator Rajesh Agarwal, aiming to bridge gaps in the proposed bilateral agreement.

title: JSW Paints to acquire AkzoNobel India; deal valued at Rs 8,986 crore
content: JSW Paints will acquire a 74.76% stake in Akzo Nobel India (ANIL) from Akzo Nobel NV for up to Rs 8,986 crores. The deal, pending regulatory approval and a tender offer, brings brands like Dulux into the JSW fold. JSW aims to build the next-generation paint company, leveraging ANIL's strong market position.

title: IND vs ENG - 'How many dams will Bumrah be able to construct?': Ashwin tears into Siraj
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has voiced concerns over Mohammed Siraj's performance in the recent Test match against England, urging him to prioritize controlling the run flow over solely focusing on taking wickets. Jasprit Bumrah stood out as India's best bowler in England‚Äôs first innings, claiming a five-wicket haul. Prasidh Krishna also picked up three wickets but was expensive, conceding runs at an economy of 6.40.

title: Gold rate outlook for June 27; does a 'sell on rise' strategy makes sense?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold futures are experiencing selling pressure, trading near ‚Çπ97,087, influenced by a bearish technical outlook. Analysts suggest a 'Sell on Rise' strategy for June 27, specifically in the ‚Çπ97,300‚Äì‚Çπ97,400 range, targeting ‚Çπ96,700 and potentially ‚Çπ96,200.

title: 'Iran can never get nukes': US secretary of state Rubio talks tough with Pak PM
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned Pakistan about Iran's nuclear ambitions during a call with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. This followed US military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, sparking controversy in Islamabad.

title: Trump accuses Democrats of leaking intel on Iran strike; calls for prosecution
content: President Trump accuses Democrats of leaking intelligence regarding a U.S. strike on Iranian nuclear sites, calling for prosecution. The FBI is investigating the leak of a DIA report suggesting the strikes were ineffective, with the administration suspecting a personal grievance against Trump motivated the leaker.

title: 'Will attack more US bases if ...': Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei issues threat
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in a televised address, warned of targeting US military bases in the Middle East if attacked, claiming victory after striking a US base in Qatar. He dismissed Trump's demands and asserted Iran's capability to strike American facilities. Netanyahu proclaimed a historic victory for Israel, vowing continued collaboration with Trump against common enemies.

title: SSC MTS, Havaldar 2025 registration starts: Over 1000 vacancies announced- apply now
content: The Staff Selection Commission has released the notification for the SSC MTS and Havaldar Examination 2025, with applications open on ssc.gov.in. A total of 1075 Havaldar vacancies have been announced, while MTS vacancies are being compiled. The exam will be held from September 20 to October 24. Applications close on July 24, 2025.

title: ‚ÄòHibanama‚Äô: MP‚Äôs driver gets Rs 150cr ‚Äògift‚Äô; Hyd's Salar Jung heirs involved; EOW flags deal
content: The driver of Shiv Sena MP Sandipan Bhumre and his MLA son, Vilas, is under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) regarding a gift deed ('Hibanama') for a prime three-acre land worth ‚Çπ150 crore. The land, located in Dawoodpura, was purportedly gifted by descendants of the Salar Jung family of Hyderabad.

title: Tesla shake-up: Who is Omead Afshar? Senior executive reportedly fired by Elon Musk
content: Omead Afshar, a key aide to Elon Musk and Tesla's VP of Manufacturing, is now out of job. This happened amidst Tesla facing sales challenges in North America and Europe. The dismissal comes just before the end of Q2. Afshar's exit follows Milan Kovac's departure. Tesla's brand image is suffering. Analysts predict a drop in Tesla's Q2 deliveries.

title: Punjab gang war: Gangster's mother shot dead in Batala
content: In Amritsar, Harjit Kaur, mother of gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria, and his aide Karanvir were fatally shot. Unidentified assailants on a motorcycle opened fire on their vehicle in Urban Estate. Karanvir died instantly, while Kaur succumbed to injuries in the hospital. Haryana gangsters Prabhu Dasuwal and Kaushal Chaudhary, linked to the Bambiha gang, claimed responsibility via social media.

title: 'Grave concerns': India slams Bangladesh over Durga temple demolition in Dhaka
content: India has strongly condemned the demolition of a Durga temple in Dhaka's Khilkhet, accusing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government of siding with extremists. The ministry of external affairs expressed deep concern over the incident, stating the government failed to protect the temple and allowed its destruction despite potential alternatives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 25,600; BSE Sensex opens over 100 points up
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday on the back of favourable global cues. While Nifty50 was near 25,600, BSE Sensex was up over 100 points.

title: 'Trying to do better' ‚Äì How a Spider-Man dialogue inspires India U-19 cricketer Harvansh Singh
content: India U-19 wicketkeeper-batter Harvansh Singh Pangalia shared how he was struggling at 13 off 23 balls before something clicked ‚Äî and went on to score a blistering 103 off 52 deliveries against England U-19 in a warm-up match. The 18-year-old is a Marvel fan, and his life motto revolves around a famous dialogue from Tobey Maguire's Spider-Man movie.

title: Himachal horror: Woman dies by suicide on Facebook live in Solan, blames self for lover‚Äôs death
content: A 20-year-old woman in Solan district allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself at her home in Olgi village, while live-streaming on Facebook. Police recovered a register where she explained her actions, citing her family's disapproval of her relationship and her belief that she was responsible for her partner's earlier suicide.

title: Telangana: How wife‚Äôs affair with boss led to husband‚Äôs murder
content: In Jogulamba Gadwal, police arrested eight individuals, including a newly-wed woman and her lover, for the murder of land surveyor Ganta Tejeshwar. V Tirumala Rao, the lover, and Aishwarya, the wife, orchestrated the crime, hiring contract killers with promises of cash. The gang murdered Tejeshwar on June 17, dumping his body in a canal after befriending him under false pretenses.

title: DRS disaster? Three shocking umpiring decisions in two days rock WI vs AUS Test- WATCH
content: The first Test between West Indies and Australia is marred by controversial third-umpire decisions. Several contentious calls by third umpire Adrian Holdstock have significantly impacted both teams, leading to widespread debate.

title: SCO Summit: India nixes Pakistan-China bid to push their line on terror
content: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation meet in Qingdao, India refused to endorse a joint statement on terrorism due to Pakistan's attempt, supported by China, to include unrelated issues and downplay cross-border terrorism. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized that there should be no double standards in addressing terrorism, stressing the need to hold perpetrators accountable.

title: Michelle on divorce rumors; explains why she's rarely seen with Barack Obama
content: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama has addressed rumors about her marriage with Barack Obama, attributing their infrequent public appearances to their age, stating they are "too old for Instagram". She explained her deliberate choice to skip high-profile events, prioritizing personal choices over public expectations. Obama also reflected on scaling back her ambitions as a working mother and first lady.

title: Stock recommendations for June 27 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a bullish outlook for the Indian stock market, highlighting Tata Steel and Lloyds Engineering Works as top picks. Nifty is expected to reach 25,700-25,900, while Bank Nifty aims for 58,500, driven by positive market breadth and technical breakouts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal go up against Spurs for Eberechi Eze
content: Arsenal have stepped up their efforts to beat rivals Tottenham in the race for Eberechi Eze. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLA ‚ÄòPoovai‚Äô Jagan Moorthy non-cooperative, must be arrested: CB-CID at Madras High Court in Tiruvallur teen kidnap case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran decides to pass orders on his anticipatory bail petition during the course of the day

title: Theft at Kerala High Court judge's residence, six grams of gold of private secretary missing
content: An officer of Kalamassery police station said the theft occurred on June 23 and a complaint regarding this was received on June 26

title: BBMP Restructuring Committee members among 53 persons to receive Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Award in Bengaluru
content: The awards will be conferred at an event in Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) headquarters on June 27 evening

title: Zohran Mamdani's win should be an example for Congress: Digvijaya Singh
content: "The method of campaigning in cities by Mamdani is an example for Congress. Will we dare? Are we ready to raise our voice against injustice?" the Congress MP posted on X in Hindi

title: Lord Murugan conference: AIADMK ‚Äòremained silent‚Äô on video clip criticising Annadurai fearing BJP, says Chidambaram
content: Mr. Chidambaram said the AIADMK dignitaries who attended the conference should have walked out of the venue when a video clip criticising the Dravidian stalwarts was played at the event held in Madurai on June 22.

title: Retired HMT employees await retirement benefits; coordinator says more than 40 colleagues died without receiving dues
content: Many of them, now elderly and ailing, allege that they were denied basic entitlements such as gratuity, provident fund, and leave encashment

title: Arrests made in Haryana‚Äôs Aravalli forest fire, says Nuh Deputy Commissioner
content: According to police, plastic pickers dumping plastic and chemical waste on the ground caused incidents of fire.

title: JSK ‚Äì Janaki vs State of Kerala row:  Malayalam film bodies to protest before CBFC office in Kerala capital
content: Protest on June 30 against ‚Äòarbitrary film certification‚Äô adopted by Central Board of Film Certification

title: Congress 'appeasement' of illegal immigrants led to massive encroachment of Satra land: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma affirmed the BJP-led ruling dispensation's commitment to reclaim the land for these Vaishnavite monasteries

title: Bihar Assembly polls: No confusion or dispute in Mahagathbandhan on Tejashwi being face for CM's post, says Kanhaiya Kumar
content: Kanhaiya Kumar asserted that issues would be paramount in the polls and there was "a conspiracy" by rivals to divert attention by raking up the matter of the coalition's CM face.

title: JD(S) leader Nikhil Kumaraswamy demands white paper on Kalyana Karnataka funding, development
content: JD(S) leader raised pointed questions about the effectiveness of the ‚Çπ5,000 crore said to be earmarked for the development of Kalyana Karnataka

title: Kerala govt allocates ‚Çπ122 crore to KSRTC in financial assistance
content: Of this, ‚Çπ72 crore has been allocated for pension distribution, while the remaining ‚Çπ50 crore is the financial assistance to the public utility, including for paying the overdraft dues

title: Telangana Govt to digitise Cabinet meeting files henceforth
content: The State cabinet will convene a status review meeting every three months with focus on reviewing Action Taken Reports (ATRs) of decisions made in previous meetings

title: Evacuated over 4,400 Indian nationals from Iran, Israel in 19 special flights so far, says MEA
content: A fresh batch of 173 Indians evacuated from Iran reached Delhi late Thursday (June 26, 2025) night in a flight from Armenian capital Yerevan, the MEA said

title: India finds out about decisions important to it from White House: Congress‚Äô dig on ‚Äòtrade deal‚Äô
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that "after repeating 16 times" that he used a trade deal to bring ceasefire between India & Pakistan, Mr. Trump has now announced that India-U.S. trade agreement is going to be signed in next few days

title: Kerala rains: Many rural schools remain closed in Kozhikode district
content: Shutters of Kakkayam dam in Kozhikode and Banasura Sagar dam in Wayanad opened following heavy inflow from catchment areas

title: Trump says 'very big' trade deal coming up with India
content: Donald Trump‚Äôs remarks come as an Indian team arrived in Washington for the next round of trade talks with the U.S.

title: How the new U.S. visa rules affect your online privacy | Explained
content: Privacy experts have slammed the U.S. government‚Äôs new social media vetting requirements, likening the country‚Äôs approach to that of an authoritarian regime. However, they note it is difficult to claim that privacy laws are being broken as visa applicants can choose to ignore the request, though they put their visa application at risk by doing so

title: India‚Äôs start-up ecosystem witnessed exponential growth over the last decade, with a surge in early-stage funding, digital penetration: Meta
content: ‚ÄòTier 2 and 3 markets are becoming the new battlegrounds for scale. USA, UAE, and the UK emerged as the top export markets‚Äô

title: Discover Koraput: Odisha‚Äôs hidden gem of peaks, tribes and pristine landscapes
content: A trip to Deomali and Talamali, Odisha‚Äôs twin hills, offers a taste of sweeping altitudes, quiet encounters with Nature and a rare glimpse of Koraput‚Äôs highland soul

title: Search operation to track down three JeM terrorists underway in J&K‚Äôs Basantgarh
content: A Pakistan-based JeM terrorist was killed in an encounter with security forces on Thursday, and three of his associates remain trapped in the forested area of the Basantgarh belt.

title: The curious case of the ‚Äòmissing‚Äô Shah Commission report on Emergency and its eventual rediscovery
content: Once Indira Gandhi was back in power in 1980, no one could get hold of the three-volume Shah Commission report

title: Is India plumbing the depths of groundwater?

title: A tightrope walk for Chittoor‚Äôs mango farmers

Poor MSP enforcement, alleged collusion among factories, and logistical bottlenecks arising out of global conflicts have exacerbated their plight, writes K Umashanker

title: Telangana‚Äôs medical college expansion: Built to heal, left to rot
content: From shuttered duty rooms and unsafe hostels to sprawling, unopened hospitals, Telangana‚Äôs bold push to set up a government medical college in every district has resulted in an overstretched, understaffed system. Students are left to teach themselves, doctors go unpaid and faculty shortage cripple learning.¬†Siddharth Kumar Singh¬†exposes a public healthcare vision mired in delays, neglect and a widening gap between promise and practice

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Iranians Are Standing With Their Regime - Even When They Hate It
content: Tunisia, where the Arab Spring began, did not wait or depend on external forces to engineer a change. It was implemented by Tunisians themselves. Any Iranian Spring, too, must begin in Iran.

title: Raped By Father-In-Law, Buried In Pit: New Details Of Faridabad Woman Murder
content: First she was raped by her father-in-law before being murdered and buried in a pit dug outside her marital home in Haryana's Faridabad. Disturbing new details have emerged in the killing of a 24-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh.

title: Hyderabad Couple Who Live Streamed Sex Acts Needed Money For Daughters' Fees

title: US Spent 15 Years Designing Bombs To Target Iran's Fordow Nuclear Site
content: Fordow, located roughly half a mile inside a mountain, came to the attention of US intelligence agencies in 2009. Soon after, defence experts determined that no existing weapon in the US arsenal could effectively destroy it.
